sub_title: Aspiring Teacher and Education Researcher and Policy Maker
summary:
I am a BSc Honours graduate from Leiden University College in The Hague, with a major in 'Governance, Economics and Development'. I am passionate about education and pedagogy, and would like to learn more about policy-making and research within these fields.
I have experience in language teaching, classroom assistance at the primary school level, workshop and informative guide design and creation, customer service, and administration. 
I have a very very diligent, responsible and curious nature and I like to use my high organisation and leadership skills to get the most out of my education and work.

awards.title: Winner of Essay Challenge
awards.description: After entering an essay on the use of journalism as an anti-corruption mechanism in Mexico and the obstacles to this, mainly the violence against journalists, my essay was selected as the winner of the challenge. The prize entailed me going to Oslo and attending all the Nobel Days events, including the  ceremony where the laureates were awarded their prizes.

awards.title: Model United Nations Best delegate award
awards.description: Received the 'best delegate' award in the The Disarmament and Security (DISEC) committee when acting as the delegate of Switzerland during an online MUN conference

awards.title: Achievement and Commitment award in IB Economics
awards.description: Recognition for performance and effort in the International Baccalaureate subject of Economics at the standard level

awards.title: MUN Outstanding delegate award
awards.description: Outstanding delegate recognition in the Office on Drugs and Crime committee while representing the United States of America in a model united nations conference

awards.title: Certificate of Achievement in IGCSE Sociology
awards.description: Received two Certificates of Achievement in the IGCSE subject Sociology

awards.title: Achievement and commitment in IB CAS
awards.description: Recognition for effort in the International Baccalaureate 'Commitment, Activity, and Service' component

courses.name: Introduction to Dialogue by the Ignitor Fellowship
Módulo General de la Escuela de Incidencia Latinoamericana Feminista Anticorrupción
Online Summer Course on Crime, Law and Psychology by Prague Summer Schools

profile_positions.description: Working for the Academy a second time, I am now helping coordinate their sixth yearly conference on the theme 'Your Organization Needs Dialogue!' My role involves contacting the dialogue co-facilitators and gathering information to organise the daily sessions of the conference.
profile_positions.title: Conference Coordinator

company.name: Embassy of Mexico in The Netherlands

profile_positions.company: Embassy of Mexico in The Netherlands
profile_positions.description: My work involved processing and filing various types of services, such as visa applications, passports, birth registries, among others. I was also responsible for responding to the many phone and email queries the Consulate received daily so that we can provide the required information and support to both fellow Mexicans and international users.
profile_positions.title: Administrative Staff

profile_positions.company: Embassy of Mexico in the Netherlands
profile_positions.description: I worked within the Educational Services Area at the Embassy of Mexico in the Netherlands within the Ministry of Innovation, Science and Technology. My tasks involved being the Secretary of Drafting for the area's magazine, as well as Customer Services, and contributing to an interactive map that provides information on Mexican researchers working in The Netherlands. I collaborated in the Section of Attention to Users of Educational Services to provide users with educational information about Mexico and The Netherlands. I also worked together with the Chancellor of Innovation, Science and Technology to create an Electronic Resource Center for Mexican students in the Netherlands. Besides connecting the Mexican minds in The Netherlands and allowing for collaborations among them and with the Embassy, I also attended events where the presence of the Embassy was required to make notes and promote connections.
profile_positions.title: Responsible for Management and Monitoring of the Educational Services Area

profile_positions.description: My role involved content creation and administrative tasks. I mainly helped with the administration of information and content within the organisation by gathering documents and organising them as well as maximising their usefulness and quality. I was in charge of engaging higher education students to attend the yearly conference held by the Academy on the topic of 'Dialogue as Story'. I was in contact with Academy members to share relevant content with their student network and colleagues, and I created content to be distributed in order to promote the conference.
profile_positions.title: Student Coordinator

profile_positions.description: In collaboration with someone working at PostNL's Human Resources sector, we had meetings in order to discuss both professional and personal aspects of our life to learn about each other and create more diverse settings for ourselves and our environment.
profile_positions.title: Apprentice

profile_positions.description: I tutored a GCSE student preparing for their final examinations through weekly sessions where we worked on their vocabulary, grammar, and conversation skills. I also created activities for them to practice that I could then check and work on any gaps in knowledge.
profile_positions.title: Spanish Tutor

profile_positions.description: I contributed to the creation of workshops provided to high school students and teachers aimed at teaching the audience about plastic pollution. I also worked on writing a series of blogposts about the link between fast fashion and plastic pollution.
profile_positions.title: Research Intern & Content Creator

profile_positions.description: I was a source of support for the residents who live in my floor at the university residence. I received first aid training and preparation to deal with issues such as those involving mental health or conflict resolution. It involves the use of high organisation and social skills as well as time management.
profile_positions.title: Residence assistant

volunteer_experiences.description: I volunteeed twice a week at an international primary school in classrooms of the first year of primary with students aged 7 years old as well as an Early Years class (4-6 year olds). I helped support the teachers in class by looking over the students and helping with tasks and school work as well as play-time supervision.

volunteer_experiences.role: Coordinator for Outing into Student Life and Festive Ending
volunteer_experiences.description: I was a volunteer participating in sessions where my team and I physically/virtually attended a local primary school in The Hague with the goal of creating a project guided by the class of the students we were allocated. We had sessions where we got to meet the children, hear their input, and the goal was to raise awareness in their neighbourhood about a topic of their choice which was 'Sport and health'. We created a website with healthy recipes chosen by the children and some body exercises, all of which were made into a physical recipe book to distribute in the neighbourhood. The outing into student life was a way to show them college life and we did this through a video I edited and then had a Q&A session with them.

Being the first ever Student Ambassador of the Ignitor Fellowship, I was a representative of the Ignitor Program at my university, and I worked together with the Ignitor-team, in a group of international Student Ambassadors from various Universities internationally. I was the contact person to connect fellow students at my university to the opportunities and challenges offered by the Ignitor Fellowship Program. I acted as a source of communication between my university and the program in order to give feedback to the platform and ensure that the Ignitor students were always heard in their wishes and concerns.

I was a bi-monthly contributor to my university’s magazine where I wrote pieces that often involved interviewing people at the university, either for entertainment or education purposes. The pieces I wrote include a humorous piece on what Latin American students’ experience is like at my university, highlighting certain stereotypes that others believe about their cultures, a list of students’ favourite songs, to show the readers a small array of international music, and another piece on the ‘Movember’ movement. I researched and wrote on what the movement is about, and different issues that pertain to the health of people of the male sex, as well as some ways for male readers to take care of their bodies and emotional health, for which I interviewed a participant of the movement at my university. In collaboration with two friends, we also wrote three movie reviews.
